image.altText: Man in a school attendance officer uniform

props.synopsis: Truancy officers fan out through Alice Springs on the lookout for kids who should be in school, with recalcitrant parents facing fines of $370.

title.children: On patrol with the NT's school enforcers as parents face $370 fines

image.altText: The exterior of the Don Dale Youth Detention Centre, with barbed wire in the foreground.

props.synopsis: A series of secret recordings of a detainee at the Don Dale Youth Detention Centre were thrown out as evidence in a high-profile murder trial, after a judge found they constituted a "significant" breach of surveillance laws.

title.children: Confessions of teen in Don Dale secretly recorded by justice officer

image.altText: Katherine TDD 22

props.synopsis: NT police have charged two men who were arrested after an alleged "firearms incident" in Darwin's northern suburbs on Monday.

title.children: Police charge two men after alleged 'firearms incident' in Darwin

image.altText: A close up shot of a woman wearing a white blazer and black and white shirt.

props.synopsis: In an ongoing defamation battle, court documents show Jacinta Nampijinpa Price says there was substantial truth to a media release calling for the dismissal of an Aboriginal land council CEO.

title.children: Price defends calling for land council CEO's dismissal, court documents show

image.altText: A photo showing hospital exterior with emergency and main enterance signs  at the front

props.synopsis: A man who claims he lost half his body weight and was diagnosed with "severe malnourishment" following gastric bypass surgery is suing his doctor and Royal Darwin Hospital.

title.children: Man who lost half his weight after gastric bypass sues Darwin surgeon, hospital

image.altText: An older man sitting on an enclosed verandah, with trees outside.

props.synopsis: Ian McBean — who began his career as a ringer, became a boss drover and eventually created his own cattle empire — is remembered as "a pioneer" and one of the industry's strongest advocates.

title.children: Former drover and 'true icon' of NT's cattle industry remembered

image.altText: Close-up of a lizard sculpture.

props.synopsis: A sculpture years in the making to welcome people to the town is in doubt after a government department threatened to terminate its contract with artist Steve Langton.

title.children: Future of Tennant Creek's giant Nyinkka lizards sculpture unknown

image.altText: A man and woman stand arm in arm smiling at each other.

props.synopsis: Experts are calling on the government to implement strategies that will better predict future Ozempic shortages.

title.children: Australians with diabetes feeling the squeeze from Ozempic shortage

image.altText: An aerial view of a white car on a red dirt highway. Either side of the road is arid desert with sparse greenery

props.synopsis: The Outback Way is the stuff of legends — thousands of kilometres of dirt road through the centre of Australia into uncharted territory and to places most people can only dream of seeing. But it's certainly not for the faint-hearted, writes Lisa Millar.

title.children: Dubbed Australia's longest shortcut, the Outback Way is not for the faint-hearted

image.altText: Sri Lanka batter Dinesh Chandimal plays a shot in a Test against Australia.

props.synopsis: Dinesh Chandimal is finally prised out straight after tea on day one of the second Test between Australia and Sri Lanka in Galle. Follow live.

title.children: Sri Lanka's top batter sent packing to start final session on day one

image.altText: A CIA emblem on the floor of a building.

props.synopsis: The CIA is offering all of its employees incentives to resign — and some say its part of a move by US President Donald Trump to stack the government in his favour.

title.children: Five US spy agencies are offering buyouts to every employee. Here's what's going on

image.altText: A lawyer dressed for a court and a woman in a suit arrive at the Federal Court.

props.synopsis: The ABC managing director told an unlawful termination hearing he reviewed Antoinette Lattouf's social media feeds and grew concerned about what he saw.

title.children: ABC boss asked if the Lebanese race exists in Lattouf case

image.altText: Three people holding signs with marshmallows saying 'burnt out' and 'reform now'

props.synopsis: Junior doctors in NSW are threatening to walk off the job after the circulation of an email written by an HR officer who likened them to confectionery.

title.children: Leaked email from HR calling doctors 'marshmallows' sparks fury

image.altText: Joe Schmidt looks behind him

props.synopsis: In a major blow for Australian rugby, Joe Schmidt has confirmed he will not steer the Wallabies through to the 2027 Rugby World Cup at home.

title.children: Wallabies coach Joe Schmidt to stand down after Rugby Championship

image.altText: A smiling mother with her newborn girl.

props.synopsis: Amid the tragedy and destruction in flood-ravaged North Queensland there has also been joy.

title.children: Hospital a 'beacon of light' as mum gives birth in flood-ravaged town

image.altText: Jakara Anthony and Val Guseli pose

props.synopsis: It is just one year until the 2026 Winter Olympic Games gets underway in Milan-Cortina, and off the back of its best-ever performance at a Games in Beijing 2022, Australia has plenty of hopes for more medals.

title.children: How Australia's top medal hopes shape up a year out from the Winter Olympics

image.altText: President Donald Trump holds up a signed executive order in the White House showing it to two girls standing in front of him.

props.synopsis: The order directs the Department of Justice to ban transgender girls and women from participating in female school sport and threatens to withhold funding from schools that do not comply.

title.children: Trump order aims to bar transgender athletes from female school sport

image.altText: a group of women turn face away from a speaker in protest

props.synopsis: Waitangi Day in New Zealand is marked by controversy as Māori leaders condemn a proposed bill to redefine the Treaty of Waitangi, sparking protests and political tensions.

title.children: 'The crown has filed for divorce': Treaty tensions rock Waitangi Day

image.altText: A close up of a bearded man with shaggy dark hair and a black blazer tilts his head to the left as he listens

props.synopsis: From Netflix to Disney and Amazon Prime, multiple studios have paused or cancelled adaptations of Neil Gaiman's best-selling books following allegations made by multiple women.

title.children: Projects cancelled after eight women accuse author Neil Gaiman of abuse

props.synopsis: Around-the-clock coverage of news events as they break, at home and abroad.

title.children: Watch: News Channel

image.altText: a skyline with houses

props.synopsis: The typical way the so-called "Bank of Mum and Dad" is used appears to be shifting, according to new figures that show most of the cash passed from parents to children is being used on living expenses, rather than a home deposit.

title.children: Is helping their adult children 'the price baby boomers are paying'?

image.altText: A family poses for a photo in front of a temple in Indonesia

props.synopsis: Lily Lumintang was reading an ABC story about her family's plea to remain in Australia when her lawyer called to say Home Affairs had granted their family visas, allowing them to avoid deportation and remain in Australia.

title.children: Indonesian family's Australian residency approved after ABC inquiries

image.altText: A woman with short blonde hair smiling pointing to her black t shirt which says "say something"

props.synopsis: Former Queensland Australian of the Year Rachel Downie is suing Rockhampton Grammar School for at least $5 million in compensation, arguing it failed to appropriately address her reporting of the abuse.

title.children: Child protection advocate sues elite private school over alleged abuse in 1980s

image.altText: a plume of smoke arises from a bushfire

props.synopsis: As Tasmania battles more than a dozen fires sparked by a band of dry lightning strikes, some in high-value wilderness areas, researchers are raising the possibility that this is the 'new normal'.

title.children: Tasmania's wilderness areas at increasing risk of fire, researchers say

image.altText: Kaitlyn Dever recreates Belle Gibson's infamous 60 Minutes interview, with a ponytail and pink jumper.

props.synopsis: American actor Kaitlyn Dever talks about finding the good beneath the surface of Australian cancer scammer Belle Gibson, and the rise of the wellness industry.

title.children: New series tells the story of Belle Gibson, the influencer who scammed Australia

image.altText: An old weatherboard building with sand dunes falling away, rubbish on the beach

props.synopsis: A Queensland council will put an asbestos-riddled former surf life saving clubhouse out of its misery after erosion put it at risk of falling into the sea.

title.children: Beachfront 'eyesore' to be demolished after erosion exposes foundations

image.altText: Sarah Shams in a bright pink skirt

props.synopsis: As a double above-knee amputee, I've had a complicated relationship with fashion over the years.

title.children: My clothing makes me feel fierce: The joy of dressing for myself

image.altText: A close up shot of a man in a suit and glasses.

props.synopsis: The opposition leader said Trump was a "big thinker and a deal maker" with a "genuine desire to see peace and stability".

title.children: Dutton praises 'shrewd' and 'reasonable' Trump after Gaza comments

image.altText: Tyler Wright surfs

props.synopsis: Australian surfers Tyler Wright, Isabella Nichols and Molly Picklum have reached the quarter-finals as the Pipe Pro resumed in Hawaii after a week of delays.

title.children: Surfing resumes at Pipe Pro in Hawaii as three Aussies make quarterfinals

image.altText: A car submerged in green ocean

props.synopsis: Questions are being asked about who is responsible for a submerged car found in a Bunbury waterway.

title.children: Authorities at odds over who is responsible for removing sunken car

image.altText: Side-by-side photos of Bianca Jones and Holly Bowles, two Melbourne teens who have been hospitalised in Thailand

props.synopsis: Laos has failed to accept "consistent" offers by Australian Federal Police to assist the investigation into the methanol poisoning deaths of Australian teenagers Bianca Jones and Holly Bowles.

title.children: Laos has not accepted AFP offers to aid methanol poisoning investigation

image.altText: A close shot of albanese

props.synopsis: Heads are best kept below the parapet for now, in what's already proving to be a more difficult environment to navigate than the first Trump presidency.

title.children: Albanese's careful, polite rejection of Trump finds an unusual ally

image.altText: A woman in a baby blue shirt raises her hand

props.synopsis: Senator Jacqui Lambie has railed against unfair dismissal laws, after herself facing a Fair Work case against a former staffer who claimed they were unfairly dismissed.

title.children: Jacqui Lambie rails against unfair dismissal laws, says staffer 'painted nails at their desk'

image.altText: A tiger and boar stuck in a well as a crane comes down to rescue them

props.synopsis: Officials say the unlikely pair fell into the water when the young tigress was chasing the boar.

title.children: 'Rescue mission like no other': Tiger and boar pulled out of well in India

image.altText: A boat sinking.

props.synopsis: A 1958 pilot cutter en route to the Wooden Boat Festival in Hobart has sunk in a channel after taking on water.

title.children: 'She just went under': Historic boat sinks on way to Wooden Boat Festival
